function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Increased use of balconies as a result of the pandemic may lead to crowding and close contact between individuals, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","Impact":"Potential spread of contagious diseases among residents due to close contact on balconies.","Mitigation":"Implementing guidelines for maximum occupancy on balconies, promoting social distancing, and encouraging the use of masks when using shared balcony spaces.","Technologies":"Smart sensors for monitoring occupancy, balcony partition screens, and UV sterilization devices for shared furniture on balconies.","People":"Residents, especially those living in apartment buildings with shared balconies.","Owner":"Building management, public health authorities, and individual residents."},{"Description":"Inadequate ventilation on small balconies may limit air circulation and increase the risk of airborne disease transmission.","Impact":"Higher risk of disease transmission, particularly airborne diseases, due to poor ventilation on small balconies.","Mitigation":"Installation of portable air purifiers, strategic placement of potted plants to enhance natural ventilation, and regular cleaning and maintenance of balcony vents.","Technologies":"Portable air purifiers, smart climate control systems for outdoor spaces, and plant-based air purification systems.","People":"Residents living in apartments with small balconies.","Owner":"Building management and individual residents."},{"Description":"Lack of sufficient space on balconies may lead to a higher concentration of people in indoor communal areas, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","Impact":"Increased likelihood of disease transmission in indoor communal areas due to overcrowding on balconies.","Mitigation":"Creation of designated balcony usage schedules, promotion of staggered balcony usage, and provision of alternative outdoor communal spaces.","Technologies":"Digital reservation systems for balcony usage, smart scheduling apps, and outdoor seating capacity monitoring systems.","People":"Residents living in apartment buildings with limited balcony space.","Owner":"Building management and public health authorities."}]}
